results.title: Promise in the sky
results.creator_credit: London Television Service, Judy Davison and Bill Metcalfe
results.brief_description: Uses special effects to show how the new generation of European and American satellites are being used to preserve life on earth. Includes glimpses of earth from outer space.
results.creator_credit_for_label: London Television Service, Judy Davison and Bill Metcalfe

results.title: Promise
results.brief_description: The tale of an old woman overseeing her grand-daughter making some damper when she is asked how it came to be that she was betrothed at a young age.
results.description: The tale of an old woman overseeing her grand-daughter making some damper when she is asked how it came to be that she was betrothed at a young age.

results.title: Prologue
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Robin Spry
results.brief_description: A story focusing on the youth-rebellion movement of 1968, revolving around Jesse (John Robb) a young Montrealer who edits an underground newspaper. He and his female companion are joined by David (Gary Rader) a young draft dodger from the United States. In the choices they make, the two rival philosophies of dissenting youth become evident: militant protest or communal retreat. The film includes some of the bloody rioting in Chicago during the 1968 Democratic Convention. Also seen and heard in the film is anti-war and civil rights spokesman Abbie Hoffman. Other members of the Intellectual Left making brief appearances in Prologue include Allen Ginsberg, Jean Genet, John Kenneth Galbraith, and William S. Burroughs. Cast includes: Elaine Malus, Christopher Cordeaux, Peter Cullen, Frank Edwards, Henry Gamer, Robert Girolami and Victor Knight. Script, Sherwood Forest. Editing, Christopher Cordeaux. Music, Bill Brooks, Michael Malus and The Ventures. (Awards: London, Toronto, Colombo)

results.title: Projekt No. 6
results.brief_description: This guide to research and access to local video artist’s work is intended as an important resource for all curator’s, galleries, students and art lovers with a desire to better understand and appreciate a thriving cultural medium. Contains artworks which have been shown in a gallery context from established, mid career and emerging artists from Australia. The artists included on this tape are: Kate Murphy, Lyndal Jones, David Noonan, Simon Trevaks, Alex Gawronski and Monika Tichacek. Sponsored by the City of Melbourne, The Victorian College of the Arts and the Kings Artist Run Space.

results.title: Projector test film
results.brief_description: THE PRINTS FOR THIS TITLE HAVE BEEN CHOSEN AS TEST PRINTS FOR THOSE CLIENTS (OR POTENTIAL CLIENTS) OF THE CINEMEDIA ACCESS COLLECTION WHO WISH TO TEST THEIR PROJECTOR. ADVISE CLIENT THAT THEY SHOULD NOT SCREEN ANY OTHER FILMS UNTIL THEY HAVE PLAYED THE PRINT THROUGH IN ITS ENTIRETY AND ARE CERTAIN THE PROJECTOR IS IN GOOD WORKING ORDER. FOR ANY FURTHER DETAIL PLEASE CONTACT EITHER DESPATCH STAFF OR THE MANAGER OF THE 16MM COLLECTION REVIEW PROJECT. AC 6/11/1997
